page.title: 15Horatio Bottomly.
page.content: and at present is used by St. Bede's private school. He bought the field next to the Plough Inn and turned it into a beautiful garden with lake and island reached by a willow pattern type bridge. He also built an unusual circular greenhouse. He loved horses and built the Stud House complete with stables and gallop. He also built the cottages known as Stud Cottages for his stable lads and jockeys. The Dicker Stud has been recently acquired by St. Bede's school to house their boarding pupils.He bought all the old cottages he could and completely transformed the village. Most of the villagers remember him with affection for most of their relatives were employed by him. They also remember him letting each villager use his telephone which was the first in the village. He died
